CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 13 and P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON obtained a loan from ORG . In DATE , due to the failure of PERSON to repay the loan , the bank sold her flat to Mr S. The latter sold the flat to PERSON . , who further sold it to Mr G. On DATE the applicant purchased the flat from Mr G.

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the GPE ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) , seeking the eviction of PERSON and her minor child from the flat . PERSON lodged a counter - claim and requested the court to invalidate all the sales contracts concerning the flat . The parties to these contracts were summoned to participate in the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant and ordered the eviction of Mrs S. together with her child .

CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant requested an extension for lodging an appeal in cassation . On DATE ORG granted the extension requested on the ground that she had missed the initial deadline through no fault of her own .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) rejected the defendant ’s appeal in cassation against the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the Deputy General Prosecutor of GPE , following the complaint of the defendant , lodged a request for supervisory review ( protest ) of the applicant ’s case with the ORG of ORG . On DATE the ORG allowed the request , quashed the decisions of DATE and DATE , and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It found that the lower courts misinterpreted the facts and law in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found for the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant requested an extension for lodging her appeal in cassation . On DATE ORG granted the extension requested . It found that ground that the defendant had missed the initial deadline through no fault of her own .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Vatutinskyy Court found against the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the Vatutinskyy Court granted the applicant an extension for lodging his appeal , as he had not been informed about the decision of CARDINAL DATE in due time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration on the ground that the first instance court had considered the case in the absence of PERSON and PERSON . , and the third parties to the proceedings , PERSON and Mr PERSON , who had not been informed about the hearings .

CARDINAL . By the decisions of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , ORG discontinued the consideration of the applicant ’s claims and the counter - claim of the defendant because of their failure to attend the hearings on the same dates .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation to ORG of GPE against the decision of DATE , of which he had been informed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration on the grounds that ORG had failed to inform the applicant about the date and place of the hearing DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( the former ORG ) found for the applicant and ordered the eviction of PERSON together with all other persons residing in that flat . The court held that the applicant had lawfully acquired the flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant appealed against the judgment of DATE . On DATE the Desnyanskyy District Court of GPE granted the defendant a time - limit to rectify the shortcomings of her appeal .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the defendant lodged with the same court the corrected version of her appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG rejected the defendant ’s appeal against the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG rejected the defendant ’s request for leave to appeal in cassation .
